Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Ctnwd
Reviews.Content: We stay here when flying in or out of Sky Harbor. When we stay one night, they let us park for free and take us to the airport and pick us up when we get back. They have a great breakfest buffet. One trip our car battery was dead and they pulled out a portable starter and helped us get going. Nice people and very customer friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice near the airport”
Reviews.Author: reliantship
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay at Hampton Inns for business travel and this was one of the best. Everyone at the front desk was friendly and helpful. All of the expected services were there, including the free breakfast, wifi and business center. They arranged a shuttle to catch my flight and recommended the Golden Buddha in the Chinese Cultural Center across the street for dinner and I enjoyed it. Room was nicely decorated, clean and comfortable. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-flight hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TDS1959
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight here for an early morning departure the next day. The large room was clean, comfortable, and up to date! The staff was very friendly, courteous, and knowledgable. The shuttle van was a huge help, and the driver was great! We dropped our car off early the day before our flight so we wouldn't have that hassle, and save some time the next day. The van picked us up at the rental facility, and brought us back to the hotel. They also took us to the airport early the next morning. The Ruby Tuesday restaurant was within walking distance, and was very good. Our only complaint was the AC was going on and off the entire night, as there was not constant fan option. The jacuzzi was out of order while we were there. They could also start the breakfast a bit earlier, since this is an airport hotel, and quite a few folks left before they started serving the included breakfast. Otherwise we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Just what was needed after a long flight”
Reviews.Author: GQGQ
Reviews.Content: Arriving very tired and dishevelled after a very long flight from the UK we were quickly heartened by the warm good humoured arrival at the Hampton Inn. The room was excellent (we booked the king suite which has two queen beds in an adjoining separate room). The bed linen was very high quality and the included breakfast was really good too. The reception arranged a free shuttle to a local restaurant and to the airport for our car hire. Strongly recommended for those touching down and in need of a nice place to start your visit after a long haul.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was nice. Hotel was "OK" Would stay again but not as good as other Hampton Inns”
Reviews.Author: NyTravelinMan14
Reviews.Content: I arrived and was pleasantly surprised that there was a free 24 hr shuttle to/from the airport. They told me it would be 15 minutes wait but was about 10 or less. The driver was very nice and the front desk staff was pleasant and efficient on check in. They were friendly as well. I got to the room and the AC was not functioning. After troubleshooting and calling the desk, I found the unit was unplugged! UGH. I went to wash my hands in the bathroom sink and the drain is so slow, it took 20 minutes to completely drain. The shower head was less than great. The rest of the room was fine. The bed was comfortable. Breakfast was OK. However, if you eat oatmeal, you won't here. There was more water than oatmeal :( It wasn't good at all, nor was it very hot. The rest of the breakfast was good, as was the coffee. It is a little inconvenient to have to tear the wrap off every cup you need to use though.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient-Near the Airport”
Reviews.Author: AAMEL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the day we arrived in Phoenix and the night before our flight home. It was very convenient and the rooms were well equiped and clean. The breakfast was fine, although there is not much room for all the guests. There is transportation to the airport nearby, although we had a rental car, so didn't need to use it. Request a room away from the pool, if you want to go to sleep early. The pool is open until 10 pm. There is a nice business center with two computers and a printer. We had good dinner at the Sheraton, a short walk on the same side of the street, when we didn't want to take the car to find a place to eat. It is a safe area and there is plenty of free hotel parking.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: raquelrattle
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure what to expect from this hotel as hadn't stayed at a Hampton before. We found a very nice and friendly hotel with big rooms and plenty of towels (I always comment on the towels as when I was younger we would stay in hotels as a family of four but there would only be towels for 1 person!). The hotel is very close to the airport but no airport noise. It seems that it's a business area nearby and we did get traffic noise from the road. Decent size car park. The light rail is only a couple of blocks away and at only $1.75 for a single trip (85c for seniors) it's surprisingly cheap (the light rail in Las Vegas is $5 per trip with no discount for seniors!). Although, make sure that Phoenix is open when you go - virtually everything was shut when we were there. As it's a Hampton there is no restaurant but you do get a microwave and fridge. There are restaurants nearby and the Golden Buddha Chinese over the road was excellent. Breakfast was very good but could be crowded and hard to get a table. The shuttle bus was good and swift. I have a good opinion of Hampton Inns now - will choose again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Hotel Close to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Harold028
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in February 2012 on a business trip. The hotel was very clean, quiet and comfortable. The hotel staff was very freindly, accomodating and knowledgeable. They provided great recommendations for lunch and dinner. The chinese restaurant across the street was great. My room was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was very good and the whole breakfast area was very clean. The selection was the typical very good Hampton Inn selection that included oatmeal, cereals, fruit, eggs and waffles. This hotel is close (10 minute easy drive) to the airport, has ample parking and is in a good part of the city. I recommend this hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Clean! Modern up to date!”
Reviews.Author: FreqTrav24
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Will stay everytime I am in the area. Close to popular dining chains and shopping. Hotels staff was great. Greeted with smiles and thank you's. Clean spacious rooms. Up to date with modern decor. Did utilize pool area but appeared clean! Overall great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet place near the airport, safe, average”
Reviews.Author: analise
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights for an event we were attending at the Fairgrounds which was about 10-15 minutes away. We read about the lighted parking lot with cameras in another review about this property and that made us feel safer. Sure enough the hotel is surrounded by more upscale properties, it has the feel of a business park and we never heard a siren or saw anything suspicious. The local police seem to make a habit of having breakfast at this location which added to the secure feeling. The staff was efficient but not overly friendly, the breakfast leader was impatient with one of the older guest who needed a little help. The hotel itself was OK, seemed a little bit older and perhaps in need of a good scrubbing and a touch up here and there but it fit our needs and we slept very well. The rooms were very quiet and beds were comfortable with that typical lumpy Hampton comforter, the towels were thick and soft. Breakfast was disappointing, scrambled eggs were dry (not sure if they were real or not). Eggs and gravy were the only hot items, other than the typical make your own waffles, it looked like any other breakfast at less expensive hotel chains. There was a lack of restaurants close by, we had to drive to eat dinner. We thought it was overpriced but that's probably the going rate in Phoenix in the winter. We might look for a safe but cheaper property in Tempe next year. But if I needed to be near the airport, I would probably consider this place again, it's ok.

Reviews.Title: “Not for short people”
Reviews.Author: ITSkier
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Reception and hotel room very good - except bathroom counter and sink are 8 to 9 inches higher than standard. No way could my wife or I even bend over set-back sink to brush our teeth or wash our face. Water everywhere. Wife could not even get close to mirror for makeup. We won't stay there again. There are a number of "normal" hotel rooms in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Heated pool and comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: Finoke
Reviews.Content: Any place you can go in January and sit by a heated pool and soak up the sun is inviting to me but this hotel has the heated pool on the sunrise side of the hotel so we were out there by 9:30 am and just loving it! The rooms are what you would expect at t Hampton, spacious and comfortable. One reason I prefer Hampton's in general is the breakfast they offer. This one was not quite as good as most unfortunately. There was plenty to eat and a lot of variety but the quality of the hot food was not as good as most Hampton"s I've stayed at. Having said that I would return if in the Phoenix area ... especially in January!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hampton Inn for Phoenix Airport”
Reviews.Author: Onth3rdagn
Reviews.Content: Easy in/out of airport, and a great Hampton to boot. Also easy in/out of town and within 5 min of I10. Stayed 4 nights and service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convienent”
Reviews.Author: WorldWanderer22
Reviews.Content: I would expect nothing less from a Hampton Inn. Clean, comfortable rooms. Above average complimentary breakfast with lots of choices. Friendly staff always ready to help. I will always prefer a local Inn or B&B, but when you are in town for one whirlwind evening you can't go wrong. This Hampton also had the benefit of being just 2 blocks from the "lite rail" so even without a car Phoenix is at your fingertips.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average for Hampton Inn and very Close to airports”
Reviews.Author: taprennoc
Reviews.Content: Im pretty sure I have stayed at every Hilton property around the Phx airport over the years. This was definitely the nicest Hampton I have stayed in at the airport, and just as good as the local doubletree, and a better value. Nice big b'fast room, not just some tables crammed into the lobby. Great friendly staff. Ample free parking. Felt like a safe secure area. I will definitely check this hotel rates first next time I go back. Thanks for a nice stay guys.. Although I did miss my free water and snack I usually get at other Hamptons.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly good for an airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: knatalie
Reviews.Content: we flew into Phoenix around 11 pm on Christmas day, so we figured it was better to stay in a hotel close to the airport. Usually i figure that these types of hotels are no frills and spartan. Hampton Inn was a nice surprise- first their shuttle runs 24 hours so our late arrival was no problem, we called the hotel from courtesy phone and got picked up. the next day we had to go back to get our rental cars and we went back on the shuttle (check times, it ran on half hour but that may have been due to time of the year, it probably runs more frequently). the beds were very comfortable, bathrooms nice amenities, Ashley at front desk very helpful and friendly, and the breakfast was pretty good- waffle, oatmeal, usual cold cereals, scrambled eggs. We had a restful sleep because of the comfortable rooms. The microwave/fridge is nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a good hotel near the airport - stay here !”
Reviews.Author: MaryJim2468
Reviews.Content: This Hampton provides free airport transportation. When I arrived at baggage claim, I called for a pick up and 10 minutes later, the bus arrived promptly. The rooms are clean and comfortable - typical Hampton Inn rooms. The breakfast is better than most Hamptons with added variety that you don't see like strawberry's and fresh oatmal. The service is one of the best I've seen. The only advice I would give you is to ask for a room that does not face the main road as it does get noisy. Other than that, stay here if you're looking for a quick stay to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff nice room!”
Reviews.Author: sharadeeobrien
Reviews.Content: Stay there often for business and the staff every single one of them are always so pleasant! Rooms are very nice and updated! Nice free breakfast with lots to choose from!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: joy s
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. I was able to check in early. Had a great room with microwave and small fridge. Very comfortable. Beds are great. Lighting is good. Had a great swim in the pool and then a soak in the lovely hot tub. Room was quiet. Breakfast was wonderful. They even had freshly made oatmeal! I was very happy to be able to arrive at airport and get shuttle to hotel. The next day they took me back to airport so that I could go to the car rental and pick up my vehicle, drive back to hotel and get my luggage before moving on. All went very efficiently. I would definitely stay there again. Only problem was, very few restaurants nearby to go for dinner without a car.

Reviews.Title: “Stay and park”
Reviews.Author: daveinsedona
Reviews.Content: Found this to be a great deal for us when we have to leave town for a few days or more. This location allows you to park your car in their secure (cameras) lot for free while you're away. We need to stay in Phoenix the night before our flight so this takes the hassle out of trying to find a place to leave our car. Plus the free parking helps offset the cost of the room by eliminating the need to park at a Park and Ride facility. They've allowed us to leave our car for up to three weeks and they probably would allow longer if you asked. Combined with the pretty decent breakfast, free USA Today, friendly staff and the excellent shuttle service (ten minutes to terminal) it's hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk staff is excellent”
Reviews.Author: canyonbound
Reviews.Content: The shuttle service was great, and very prompt. Everyone we met at the front desk was very friendly and had a great positive attitude. The room was very clean, and very comfortable. Breakfast had a wide variety and the food was good. We were within a few miles of a few car rental places so that we didn't have to pay the outrageous rental prices at the airport (Enterprise can pick you up or the shuttle will take you anywhere within three or so miles of the hotel). I would definitely stay here again. The convenience and friendly staff made it a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Conner2dood
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights prior to flight home. Good Inn located in modern business area close to airport. A car is necessary if you want to get to shopping, restaurants, etc. If you have a rental car and an early flight, the rental return location is not in the airport terminal itself. It took me over an hour to return car and take airport shuttle to terminal. suggest returning car the night before and using hotel shuttle which runs 24 hours. If you have a car, about 1 mile down 44th street you will find plenty of stores, restaurants, and other services.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: TravMuch
Reviews.Content: I'm staying at this location just for 1 night because I'm flying out of Skyharbor at 5 am. Shuttle. Service is what I need most but this great hotel is allowing me to park my car here for 2 weeks while I'm gone. Room is adequate staff is extremely friendly and helpful and cheerful. Not sure I'd want to spend a lot of time here as a destination hotel but I got a sweet deal and I'm thrilled. Room is clean, tv works, there's even a breakfast to go for us early risers who leave before the 6 am breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: maryanddave
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at his hotel on a number of occasions when using Sky Harbor. The park and ride feature is terrific. Staff is always very cordial and helpful. For anybody (such as ourselves) driving any distance before flying out of PHX, this is the place to stay the night before your flight and leave your car while you are gone. Their shuttle has always been very reliable.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE, LOVE, LOVED IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: thespiderman2011
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at this Hampton Inn. The bed is absolutely amazing! The room was very clean. It had a couch, flatscreen, and even a playstation. (Though we didn't use the playstation.) The rate for this hotel was very reasonable. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if looking to be near the airport”
Reviews.Author: MSMiller-author
Reviews.Content: We don’t normally stay near the airport when traveling and if we had more time in Phoenix, we would have much preferred to be downtown (although this was way more economical). That said, this is a nice hotel, with a good outdoor pool, and a standard but perfectly fine complimentary breakfast. It is literally a five minute ride to the airport, a short drive or taxi to the desert botanical garden, and an easy light rail ride to Chase Field where the Diamondbacks play or to downtown Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: gogirlga
Reviews.Content: Every Hampton Inn has the great comfort level, but Hampton Inn North has a very special person in management , Diane Robins, who also has staff who follow her lead. Diane is personable , friendly, and always involved in some way helping the community. We have stayed here multiple times while coming back from volunteer work that we do in northern AZ. There is usually a function going on at this hotel which involves people helping others in some way. We feel so welcomed here by all the staff. The hotel is near our favorite restaurant, The Stockyards, and we go there on the hotel shuttle. The hotel staff always gives detailed directions to the places of interest that we want to see such as The Heard Museum, small restaurants, near by towns such as Scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dm131
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, huge flat screen tv, wonderful staff. I really enjoyed my week long stay. Very convenient to the airport and easy to get around Phoenix from the hotel. Thanks for having coffee available at 5am for us folks from the east coast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hokietraveller
Reviews.Content: In for a quick stay with an early am flight the next morning, I arrived in time to get some afternoon work done, and the internet connection was great. Then I had time for a workout and the exercise room, although not large, had ample equipment and a large flatscreen TV. With more than 3 people in here it would get crowded, but typical hotel exercise room. The hotel is not close to many restaurants, but there is a decent Ruby Tuesday two blocks south. The room was clean, the bed great and overall relaxing room.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT BED, GOOD PARK AND FLY DEAL”
Reviews.Author: Tal12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is super convenient to Phoenix airport, good shuttle service, quiet rooms and has GREAT BEDS. The manager let us park our car longer than the usual 2 weeks, making the value of the deal the absolute best we could get.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: grif858
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel to stay for a night or two max. Clean room, nice front desk, good location for most anything in the Phoenix area. Sheets do have a perfume to them, in case that’s a problem for you. I’d warn business travelers this may not be a good location for you if you’re requiring high speed internet to do work. Connectivity is pretty poor; don’t even think about doing VPN. Last night and even this morning I couldn’t even open a Google homepage without the page timing out (highlighted by a 7:40am “Ethostream: The internet connection at this location is currently down” message). Ethos, thanks for helping with my morning WebEx with a customer. Marriott, if you read this, please resolve this.

Reviews.Title: “Free Shuttle to Botanical Garden”
Reviews.Author: hisakyuu
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at so many Hampton Inns but we encountered the best service at this place. "A free shuttle service to anywhere the guests want to go within a 3-mile radius from the hotel." Can you imagine that? It just happened that the very famous botanical garden with great desert vegetations was within 3 miles. So they sent us there and picked us up after we were done visiting. A great introduction to Arizona. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “These Folks Know How to Treat their Guests!”
Reviews.Author: ksfmom
Reviews.Content: Our flight out of Phoenix was cancelled due to bad weather at our destination. After traveling for 16 hrs., we were exhausted and in need of a good night's rest! The helpful gentleman at the information stand at the Phoenix airport recommended this hotel as being one that would offer a shuttle and be available for a reasonable price. How right he was! Not only did we get a rate of $59 since we were "distressed" travelers, they picked us up at the airport, provided us with all the basic toiletries we were missing, took us by shuttle to a nearby Target to purchase a few other basics, offered great dining recommendations, delivered us to the restaurant, and did it all with a smile and pleasant attitude! Special kudos to Demetrius (at the front desk) and Mohammud (the shuttle driver)!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel; immaculately clean; many free amenities”
Reviews.Author: PULAOKHAO
Reviews.Content: I concur with all the other very positive reviews. This hotel is immaculately clean; great staff. Previously was Choice Hotels Comfort Suites so all rooms are spacious and have a partition separating bed from sofa-bed. Large LCD TV; good breakfast [fresh fruit, omlet [precooked], breads, muffins, juices, tea, coffee, cereals, etc.]; see website for details. My room had microwave and mini-fridge. Is not cheap but got at corporate rate of $82; usually rates are higher, which is only drawback. free business center with two computers with free internet service and microsoft word and free printers. small exercise room with one machine of each kind so if someone else is using it, you will have to wait for treadmill, etc. i took room facing east on top floor and there was only very faint highway noise; great comfortable beds; lots of lamps and light in room. window ac unit rather noisy but then they all are. apparently they have free wifi but i did not use it; used computers in business center instead

Reviews.Title: “Best value we found in AZ”
Reviews.Author: SueWhiting_NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 6 hotels in 10 days around AZ... this was the best value by far! The staff was very interested in making your stay the best possible; the beds were comfy with a choice of pillows (soft or firm), there was a separate living room area we didn't even expect! The breakfast was hot and cold, lots of foods available, and staff around cleaning up and making sure you were happy. We got a call in our room shortly after arrival to make sure everything was okay. The free freshly baked cookies at the check-in counter were a real nice extra! Yummy. The free shuttle driver was super nice, gave us lots of tips for places to go while there, and offered to drive us anywhere free. Highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Phoenix Hampton Inn Airport North”
Reviews.Author: tashinacross
Reviews.Content: A business traveler once told me that Hampton Inn's have, by far, the best beds... and they were right... not only did I receive excellent service from the staff... but I was very comfortable... :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: ItchyFeetBTS
Reviews.Content: I was here for only one night while in Phoenix on business. My flight arrived early and I was able to check in early. The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful; they even offered to have the free shuttle bus take me to and from dinner so I didn't have to drive there in the dark. Breakfast wasn't the best I've ever had at a Hampton, but it wan't bad. All in all, I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mbob
Reviews.Content: Got the room with king size bed and jacuzzi. Room did not have bath robes. Overall the room was excellent. Refrigerator freezer had to be defrosted and was extremely small. Business center was good, internet access configuration was not as smooth due to expired and invalid access codes. Parking was adequate and hotel was close to the airport. The front desk person did not give accurate directions or even was familiar with the area and caused us a huge delay and much driving due to the massive construction going on around the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: waterlgged
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our last night of a vacation in AZ prior to flying home the next morning. For the most part this is a typical Hampton Inn with the usual breakfast and similar rooms. The rooms were however, very well kept up, and extremely clean. The hotel also has a shuttle to the airport which worked out very well for us. I was able to return our rental car the night before in order to save some time in the morning. The shuttle came to pick me up after returning the car and also delivered us to the airport very early the next morning (4:00). At the time I believe the shuttle would run basically every half hour in the morning. A very handy location if you need to be near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “The best deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: ILuvtotravel48
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the best deal for our money. The room was the least expensive of our stay in Arizona, but the room was the biggest. It was very clean and the hotel staff was awesome. Kerry at the front desk was so helpful and informative. He helped us get to the D-Backs game via the light rail system and it was a breeze. I would definitely stay here again. Everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel handy to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Nibbles55
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel for a one night stay with my teenage daughter before flying home at the end of a long trip. It was well-reviewed (thanks other Trip Advisor members for your feedback) and on-line booking was easy. Check-in was quick and straightforward. Our room was a good size and the beds were very comfortable, with a choice of pillows. The breakfast selection was quite extensive and, although there was only one hot item (which didn't look too appetizing), it was possible to put together a filling meal from the fruits, cereals and bakery items on offer. The swimming pool was clean and heated to a pleasant temperature, but they could supply bigger towels than the ones on offer. The staff were pleasant and unobtrusive and the hotel shuttle delivered us to the airport with great efficiency (special mention to William, the driver, for his helpfulness and charm). As previous reviewers have mentioned, there are some restaurants in the Chinese Cultural Center across the road from the hotel but, if you like Chinese food, give the Shanghai restaurant a miss - we had our worst meal in three weeks there. To sum up, a budget-friendly, comfortable place to stay, especially if you want to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice Near the Airport”
Reviews.Author: drichrx
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn is close to the airport. Stayed here using Hilton Honor Points because of midnight arrival at airport. Plenty of parking, and the rooms were not spectacular but nice size and clean. The sofa was separated from the bed by a wall (unusual for Hampton Inns). The place was quiet and the complimentary breakfast decent. Overal a decent choice

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: hardtopleasetexan
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, clean place to stay before catching a flight out of Phoenix. We returned our car the night before and their van picked us up promptly and returned us to the hotel. The next morning, they took us to catch an early morning flight. Great service. If you like Chinese food, the Chinese Cultural Center is directly across the street with several Asian restaurants. The hotel is a typical Hampton Inn with good service and clean rooms. We like to begin and end our trips with less expensive alternatives to more upscale accommodations for the body of our trips. We have not been disappointed. Our main criteria is cleanliness!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: liss2
Reviews.Content: We were in town visiting my brother who lives close to the airport. The location was perfect for what we needed. If you want to be close to the airport then this is the place. The hotel was very clean. Breakfast was decent. It was what you expect at a Hampton. The rooms were large and updated. Looked like a new flatscreen! The bathroom looked new and was clean. The only complaint was that the pillow was hard as a rock. I called for a feather pillow and they delivered it within 10 minutes! That pillow was a thousand times better. I really don't have anything bad to say about this hotel. We will for sure stay again when we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Xann
Reviews.Content: Hampton Inn North is close to Sky Harbor and offers a well run shuttle service. Our driver even took us to some nearby attractions. The rooms are very comfortable , I especially enjoyed the modern bathroom and great beds. Nice hot breakfast included. Front desk personell were very helpful. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Hampton stay”
Reviews.Author: Arcticfamily
Reviews.Content: We, myself and two little children, had a good 2 night stay in this hotel. The front desk staff was very helpful. They have a file of copies of clear, printed directions to some common destinations ( zoo, car rental return etc) which was much appreciated. Good location convenient to the airport as well as attractions like the zoo, the US Airways centre, Chase field. I always appreciate the predictability of Hampton standards - great beds, clean rooms and this one did not disappoint. Room was clean and quiet with a small refridgerator and microwave that was great for this family. Nice selection of fresh food at breakfast. Parking plentiful and convenient. We also,like previous reviewers experienced some problems with a somewhat bipolar cooling system - unable to keep it from swinging from uncomfortably hot to too cold . And our sink drain would not plug. In both cases attempts were made to improve the situation. There was a big dust storm while we were there that left a lot of debris in the pool - it was completely cleaned up by next morning after the storm abated. We have had nothing but good experiences with Hampton Inns anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Room reeked of smoke”
Reviews.Author: ThePopeInSedona
Reviews.Content: Our room reeked of smoke. It was awful. Anyone with asthma would have faced a dangerous situation. We complained but they were unable to give us another room. To compensate they offered us a free night within the next half year but since we did not return to Phoenix that soon the free night offer was useless. It was an unfair bargain: they got our money but we did not get what they promised and we paid for: a smoke free room.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent stay”
Reviews.Author: TXBusinessTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just finished up a three night stay at this hotel and everything was pretty good. As a Hilton Diamond member I always request the highest floor, away from the elevator, but this time I was given a room on the second floor. I asked to be put on a higher floor, but they didn't have anything available. Ok, that was fine, but the only complaint I had was being on the second floor, I heard every footstep of the party staying above me. It was very loud at times and one morning the noise actually woke me up. Other than that the hotel is in a great location, very accessible to pretty much anything you want to do in Phoenix. The front desk staff is very friendly and the overall cleanliness is good. This is my second stay at this property and I would definitely consider it for future visits to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but customer service issue handled poorly”
Reviews.Author: Trekkersocal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at one night at the Hampton Inn after seeing all the great reviews by other trip advisor travellers. The hotel is conveniently located near the PHX airport about 1 mile north of the airport, also across from the only chinese plaza in PHX complete with an asian grocery center and restaurants. Our rooms were up to standards expected for the Hampton Inn, well appointed rooms, clean and comfortable beds. There was free WI-FI, business center with 2 computers and internet access/printing, and also a fitness center with a few exercise machines and one weight training equipment. Our overall stay was pleasant, however we soon realized that the shower in the bathroom did not work properly - in fact, there was barely any water coming out of it. Initially, we approached the receptionist and they stated that since everyone else was using the showers, there was not enough pressure; we realized that this was not the case since my spouse had tried taking a shower in the late afternoon the night before and had similar problems. there was clearly not that many people using this at that time. We are still awaiting the response from management, i think this is an overall well run hotel, but would be careful of the showers; try them before you accept your room - it's hampton inn and they guarantee 100% satisfaction, so we'll see..

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness issues”
Reviews.Author: taffy2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before an early flight out the next morning. The front desk person was not overly eager to help us, but did allow us to check in early. The room was large with a separate living and sleeping area. Several of the towels were dirty or stained so ended up stealing some from the pool. Also, the floors did not appear to be vacuumed recently, or at least very well. Parking was only located at the far end of the hotel and the closest rooms were still 100 feet from the closest parking spot. The airconditioner had some issues in our room and would not maintain a constant temperature. We were up about every hour to adjust it as it was either 65 degrees or 85 degrees in the room. The pool and hot tub were nice. There was also a fitness center with the typical cardio machines but also a multi-use weight machine. Continental breakfast was fine, but nothing special. I'd probably try to stay at the Fairfield Inn by the airport instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TamiTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 1 night only, due to an early flight the next morning. We checked in at 10 pm and got a nice room on the second floor. Had dinner at the asian center across the road, returned the rental car and arrived back to the hotel at around 11.30 pm. Everybody at the hotel was very nice. The AC was blowing 63 degrees in our room and it was freezing and so I just turned it off (the control on the wall, instead of temperature, press off). So we had no problems with that, as the previous reviewer did. The room and the bathroom seed new and was nice. I'm a light sleeper, however did not detect any noise from the street, maybe because we had to leave at 5 am. The shuttle was there and on time, the breakfast was in the bag and the recipt was accurate. As far as airport hotels go, this one is very good. I would recommend this property to anybody at the airoprt in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Accessible to Airport or I-10”
Reviews.Author: TomSwyr
Reviews.Content: Easy access to the Airport or even I-10 (the Red Mountain Freeway). We usually have personal business along east McDowell Avenue. In comparing between the Embassy Suites further north along N. 44th street, this Hampton Inn looks more pleasing to the eye. In fact, further north on 44th street, there is a shopping center, i.e. Target Store, if personal items are required. The hotel went through renovations to the front lobby in comparison to our last visit in 2006. The front lobby has more of an "executive" look to it especially since dark, wood/panels were used. The front staff was friendly and receptive. The Hampton Inn food is typical with the nearby food attendent moving food around and refilling canisters. We stayed in Room 429 (on the Northweast end) and not much(if any noise from the streets/freeway). In fact, the air conditioning with temperatures set at 66 degrees was blowing most of the night. There was no way to turn the a/c off - so why have the temperature 'control' on the wall? There was also no way to 'get' coffee as the cafeteria lobby with HD TV was closed. The only other lobby open was the front desk with a few leather sofas. You do need to have an assigned access code from the Hotel if you plan to use the enclosed business room to check e-mails.... Overall, we would consider staying a 3x in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: girella
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading reviews on this web site and because it's near the airport. We wanted to leave our rented car the evening before our flight and so we needed a complimentary shuttle from and to the airport. We checked in, left our luggage in the rooms and asked what we should do once we left the car. The reception gave us all the help we needed and also fixed the shuttle for the day after. The rooms are very nice,clean and spacious. We didn't use the pool because we were too tired but considering the temperature outside it wouldn't have been a bad idea!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: Centerfield
Reviews.Content: First of all, I usually seek out Hampton Inns when traveling on business because I have found their franchise standards to be quite high, resulting in a consistency that one looks for when traveling. Free high-speed internet, comfy beds (and a variety of pillows), and a very clean room. Second, this particular Hampton Inn appears to have been recently remodeled, so I found everything to be in excellent condition. Everything from the exterior to the lobby to the rooms were excellent. Third, the front desk clerk (Christy?) was extremely friendly and was able to provide us with easy and clear directions to nighttime entertainment, as well as getting to the airport. It's amazing how everything I just described should be easily accomplished by virtually any hotel, but since today's world is mired in mediocrity, it's places like this Hampton Inn -- places that try to be better than average -- that make stays enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - as airport hotels go”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: Typical Hampton Inn in most regards. Pleasant staff, standard architecture. I arrived in Phoenix, needing a room at the last minute - they offered me a good rate, and I was thrilled to get it. However, they said their shuttle service ended at 11:00 PM, and it was about 11:05. Therefore, I should take a cab - and get this - they would pay for it! 2 points for them. (I wish the Phoenix cabbies were as pleasant as the hotel staff). So, when I got to the hotel, it was about 11:30. The room was lovely, and divided quite distinctly into a sitting and sleeping area. Just a room (not a suite), but well laid out. Comfy bed, and nice, large bathroom. So far so good. I finally unwound and fell asleep about 1:00, secure in the knowledge that I had made my return shuttle reservation for 7:00 AM (This particular property requests that you book your shuttle the night before). So, it was unfortunate that I received a call from the desk at 4:30 - wanting to know if I had planned on being on that 4:30 AM shuttle. So, that part was a bummer - but I understood the need. If I had booked a shuttle and overslept, I would want them to call. I was just annoyed that my already reduced sleep had been interrupted. There was a mixup in room numbers. Anyway, it did not detract from my overall opinion of the hotel. If I were in the area again and needed a quick sleep - the Hampton Inn Phoenix North would be on my short list.

Reviews.Title: “A suitable airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusanM2004
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel and as a fan of most Hampton Inns, I felt that this one lived up to most of their standards. It was clean and nicely decorated. They have a well equipped business center with one computer, printer, copier, etc. We asked for a top floor room as we wanted a quiet location, but were placed in the room next to the vending machines (with ice clinking down on a regular basis). Highway traffic noise was also loud at times. Both problems could be avoided had I been more astute when first entering the room. Their shuttle service to the airport is very good. The one problem that they were not able to take care of was finding pillows that weren't the size and comfort of a beach ball. The two Hampton Inns that we stayed in on this trip had large foam pillows .... nice if you like to have your head propped up on an awkward angle :-) I asked for either thinner foam pillows or feather ones. When they had not arrived 3 hours later, I phoned again but was told that they had loaned all of their other pillows out and had not received them back from the other guests. I guess if that many people are requesting different pillows, it means that most people do not find their regular pillows to be very comfortable. Their w/e rate was fairly reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Very near the airport”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good place to sleep. Best feature: near the airport. Pool was only reasonably clean. It was also heated to a very warm temperature. Expanded buffet was good. Like other Hampton Inns it features scrambled eggs shaped by a machine into pancake-like objects. Edible but no more than that. 44th street is very busy - ask for a quiet room if traffic noise is not your thing.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn Phoenix Airport North
HotelInfo.Address: 601 North 44th Street, Phoenix, AZ 85008
